en: Oh come, let us sing unto Jehovah; Let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation.
hmr: Aw hung ta u, LALPA chawimawiin hlimtakin hla sak ei tiu; Ei insandamna lungpui chawi- mawiin hlimtakin khêk ei tiu.

en: Let us come before his presence with thanksgiving; Let us make a joyful noise unto him with psalms.
hmr: Lâwmthu hrilin a hmaah fêng ei tiu khai; Inpâkna hla saka ama chawimawiin hlimtakin râwl insuong ei tiu.

en: For Jehovah is a great God, And a great King above all gods.
hmr: LALPA chu Pathien ropuitak a ni sih a, Pathien po po chungah Lal ropuitak a nih.

en: In his hand are the deep places of the earth; The heights of the mountains are his also.
hmr: Ama kuta chun hnuoi hmun inthûktakhai chu a um a, Tlâng sîp insângtakhai chu ama ta a ni bawk a.

en: The sea is his, and he made it; And his hands formed the dry land.
hmr: Tuisuoriet hi a ta a nih, ama siem a ni sih a, Khawmuol khawm hi a kutsuok a nih.

en: Oh come, let us worship and bow down; Let us kneel before Jehovah our Maker:
hmr: Aw hung unla, chibai bûkin kûn ei tiu, LALPA a mi Siemtu hmaah dingṭhaṭhuon ei tiu.

en: For he is our God, And we are the people of his pasture, and the sheep of his hand. To-day, oh that ye would hear his voice!
hmr: Ama chu ei Pathien a na, Eini hi a ran tlatna hmuna mi le, a kuta berâmhai ei ni sih a. Vawisûn hin a râwl chu lo hre ta ve unla chu aw!

en: Harden not your heart, as at Meribah, As in the day of Massah in the wilderness;
hmr: Meribaa an thaw ang khan in lungril sukngar naw ro, Thlalêra Massa ni ang khan;

en: When your fathers tempted me, Proved me, and saw my work.
hmr: Chuong lai chun in thlatuhai chun an mi fieh a, Ka thilthaw an hmu sa khawmin an mi fieh a.

en: Forty years long was I grieved with that generation, And said, It is a people that do err in their heart, And they have not known my ways:
hmr: Kum sâwm li sûng zet chu, chu suonhai chunga chun ka lungninawh a, “An lungrila ngaisuol hmang mi an na, Ka lampuihai khawm an hriet nawh,” ka tih a.

en: Wherefore I sware in my wrath, That they should not enter into my rest.
hmr: Chuleiin, “Ka châwlnaa chun lût naw ni hai,” tiin, Lunginsenin ṭawng kân khâm tah a.
